snippet.title:
Van Gogh Museum In Amsterdam A vacation to Amsterdam would not be complete without a visit to the city's Van Gogh Museum. Located in the 'Museumplein' (English: Museum Square), where you will find some of the city's other museums, the Van Gogh Museum is dedicated to the works of one of the Netherlands' most famous citizens, Vincent van Gogh. It houses some 200 paintings and 550 sketches showing Van Gogh in all his moods. This is the biggest van Gogh collection in the world and the museum itself is the most visited museum in the Netherlands, attracting almost 1.5 million visitors in 2012. Here you can find Amsterdam hotels in the museum area.
http://www.hotelschart.com/amsterdam/hotels-amsterdam-museums.htm

Museumnacht is coming! On November 3rd, 50 Amsterdam Museums are open from 7PM until 2AM for the annual Museum Night. Apart from seeing the permanent collections and temporary exhibitions there is plenty more to see and do, also for non-Dutch visitors. Enjoy live music, DJ’s, dance, performances, film, special tours, food & drinks in the many museums of the city. The Museum Night ticket provides you entrance to 50 museums, free use of all GVB buses and trams and 1 free museum visit valid until December 31st 2012.
Check out our programme (in Dutch): http://www.museumnachtamsterdam.nl/musea/hermitage-amsterdam/ and get your ticket: http://www.museumnachtamsterdam.nl/tickets
And there is also an official teaser: https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=10151189707263571
Photo: Radek Leski﻿

This weekend: Museum Weekend in the Netherlands! 400 Museums (20 in Amsterdam) will organize unique events and lower ticket prices! Because the official website is in Dutch only, feel free to ask us for more information. #Amsterdam #Museums #MuseumWeekend﻿

Stroopwaffle, museums and art in Amsterdam. #yourtimewillcome﻿
Meer weergevenMinder weergeven · Vertalen

The Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam and Van Abbemuseum in Eindhoven have joined together to purchase a major photographic work by Israeli-Dutch artist Yael Bartana, 'The Missing Negatives of the Sonnenfeld Collection' (2008) with the generous support of (Contemporary Art Fund) Outset NL.
It is the first time the two museums have jointly acquired a work for their collections. 'The Missing Negatives of the Sonnenfeld Collection' were on view this Summer in Bartana’s solo exhibition '…And Europe will be stunned' at the Van Abbemuseum.
More info: http://www.stedelijk.nl/en/news-items/joint-acquisition-of-yeal-bartana﻿
Meer weergevenMinder weergeven · Vertalen

#Fact: Amsterdam has more museums per square meter then any other city in the world.
Out of over 70 museums in #Netherlands, more than 40 of these are in #Amsterdam. So if you are wondering of where to go to see museums, Amsterdam is the right place for you.
Image credits: wikipedia.org﻿
Meer weergevenMinder weergeven · Vertalen

Taking inspiration from Elliott Erwitt once again, I have just created an album titled "Museum watching". Though I don't always enter museums when I am visiting a city, the times I do I love taking pictures inside. This picture is from the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam, taken last year. There is a big collection of Rembrandt paintings at the museum, one of which is being admired by an Italian couple in the picture below.
And be sure to check out my inspiration for starting this album, Elliott Erwitt's book Museum Watching: http://amzn.com/0714838942﻿

n8 - Museum Night Tomorrow night, 2 November, 50 Amsterdam Museums are open from 19.00 until 02.00 for the 14th edition of the annual Museum Night. Apart from the permanent collections and temporary exhibitions, there is plenty more to see and do, also for non-Dutch speaking visitors.
For 7 hours long you can enjoy live music, DJ’s, dance, performances, film, special tours, food & drinks in the many museums of the city.
By your ticket(s) on the Museum Night website.
Museum Night on Amsterdam Travel Guide﻿ http://bit.ly/AMSTravelGuide_Museumnacht
#event #museumnacht #museumnight #amsterdam ﻿
